sections.title: Installation
sections.content: In some units, the NVMe drive is configured to operate in RAID mode by default. This may prevent the boot loader from finding your boot disk. In order to fix this, press 2 to enter the Dell UEFI. Go to Storage > NVMe Operation and make sure that Select AHCI/NVMe mode is selected.

sections.title: Video
sections.content: Take a look at XPS 13 (9310) Video drivers (Talk) if you encounter any screen artifacts in qt5 programs when using mesa instead of xf86-video-intel.

sections.title: Audio
sections.content: Unlike the Dell XPS 13 (9310), this laptop's audio appears to work out-of-the-box, or at least using linux-firmware.

sections.title: Fingerprint sensor
sections.content: The fingerprint sensor in this device is not supported by the binary driver from the Dell XPS 13 (9310).
